title: Gradual - Space Penguins EP - TECHNIQUEFREE
text:
If Techniqueâ€™s Spanish connection have flown under your radar so far, hereâ€™s your chance to catch up. Now, as the rest of us know, they might be drawing from neuro and tech influences, but producers Alerstorm and Ice Stereo, aka Gradual, have been quietly and methodically evolving their own formula. Not only does this three track EP represent some of Gradualâ€™s most individual and technically advanced work to date but, crucially, itâ€™s free!

CHECK EACH TRACK FOR FREE DOWNLOAD LINKS

Release Date: 20.12.2016

title: Chris.SU - Solar Eclipse EP - EATBRAIN033
text:
Hungarian neurofunk legend CHRIS.SU returns to the EATBRAIN label in full force, following up his â€˜Underground Cultureâ€™ label anthem and State of Mind Collaboration â€˜Chariotsâ€™ with his first full EP â€“ SOLAR ECLIPSE. From the eerie and suspenseful atmosphere of the title track in collaboration with label core JADE & MINDSCAPE, to the driven filth of THE LAST LAUGH, wrapped in the sinister lyrics of NUKLEAR, through to the shimmering but powerful sci-fi aesthetics of THE ARROW, Chris.SU delivers a pure slice of heaviness for one of dnbâ€™s most vibe-laden imprints. Eatbrain smash it again in the depths of the shadow case by the solar eclipse.

Release Date: 05.12.2016

title: Zombie Cats - Alive EP - EATBRAIN033
text:
The ZOMBIE CATS make a dramatic return to the EATBRAIN label, following up their much-loved Must Eat EP with the terrors of their fresh ALIVE EP (also featuring SAFRA and core Eatbrain producer L 33). The duo lay down 5 tracks of horror-driven dnb designed to precisely shock and captivate the dance. From the insidious percussion of title track ALIVE, woven through with sinister synthesis, to the restless and driven vibes of SOULTAKER or the hard-hitting HAUNTED HOUSE collaboration with L 33 â€“ the Alive EP tears things up in perfect Eatbrain style.

Release Date: 21.11.2016

title: Bl4ck Owlz - Face Scraper EP - EATBRAIN032
text:
EATBRAIN welcome French producers BL4CK OWLZ and THE CLAMPS to their powerful roster of cutting edge neurofunk creators, delivering 5 tracks sharp-edged and brutal drum and bass â€“ perfect for sculpting the faces of ravers into deformed bass grimaces. From the annihilating percussion of title track FACE SCRAPER, through the searing and horrific but delicately driven syncopation of PRIMAL CALL and impressive impatient scattered assault of BIG SAMPLE THEORY, the FACE SCRAPER EP delivers a high degree of focused carnage. An essential addition to the ever-growing strength of Eatbrainâ€™s relentlessly impressive output.

Release Date: 07.11.2016

title: NickBee - Gears EP - EATBRAIN031
text:
EATBRAIN presents rapidly rising Ukrainian producer NICKBEE with his GEARS EP, also featuring the eerie and alluring vocals of JOANNA SYZE. With these 4 delicately balanced and keenly crafted slices of neurofunk, Nickbee displays a refined sense of structure and minimalism, whilst delivering a powerful vibe for the dance. Half of the EP drips with dystopian spirit, bristling with razor sharp edges softened in NOWHERE TO RUN and WE FIGHT by Syzeâ€™s ethereal and alien voice. The Gears EP retains a sense of tight urgency and patient precision throughout, with GEARâ€™s tilted syncopation providing a light-footed and paranoid pace, while TOGETHER WITH FUTURE delivers a hulking stepper that packs a weighty punch.

Release Date: 17.10.2016

title: Disprove - Damage EP - EATBRAIN030
text:
Disprove returns to Eatbrain in force with his DAMAGE EP, following up his hard-hitting anthems - FRQNCS and Tip Slip - from the Mirror Universe LP last year. Delivering his inimitable Brutalist style with perfectly crafted distortion and towering waves of bass, held together with dynamic and kinetic percussion. His highly anticipated arrival on the label with a full EP delivers fully against raversâ€™ expectations, showcasing the sound of aggressive perfection unique to this exceptionally talented producer.

Release Date: 26.09.2016

title: MachineCode - Mechtropolis Album - EATBRAINLP005
text:
The MECHTROPOLIS LP is landing in its full form - following up the widespread acclaim of the 4 track sampler which dropped in early Summer and elaborately demonstrating the intense production energy of MACHINECODE. From the hulking brute force of BATTLESTAR, to the lean and precisely layered and intense sound of title track MECHTROPOLIS, or the broken mechanical roller FLINTLOCK â€“ this is an LP drenched with diversity and packed with intensity. Representing a level of production that only a pair of seasoned producers such as CURRENT VALUE and DEAN RODELL can bring to the table with their MachineCode project. 2016 has seen the towering EATBRAIN label lay down a remarkable array of high-tech releases, with MachineCodeâ€™s Mechtropolis LP representing an entirely fresh and unique vision of the d&b spectrum.

Release Date: 19.09.2016

title: War - Invisible EP - BNKR002

MethLab Recordings.

title: Kelle & Juha - Mystery / Snowflakes - EMOTION038
text:
The next release on E-Motion Records sees us very proudly welcome two new faces to the team, Kelle & Juha. Whether you know them for their face melting, dark neurofunk on Disturbed Recordings or their dance floor orientated releases on Ramâ€™s sister label Program, these lads have a pretty hefty back catalogue and we are more than happy to be making an addition to it.

Their debut on E-Motion really highlights the duos versatility as a production outlet, as they focus more on the liquid, musical side of the genre with 2 beautifully crafted tracks entitled Mystery & Snowflakes.

First up, Mystery, a stunning piece of music reminiscent of that early Calibre sound we all know and love. Sublime keys float over warm sub bass notes as dream like vocal edits bellow in the background.

The flip side, Snowflakes, sees the duo continue on their journey of elegance with another stunningly formulated slice of Drum & Bass. Strings, guitar and piano combine to create elegant atmospherics, whilst the slick, sharp drums and resounding sub bass lay the foundations, all of which wrap up another fine release on E-Motion Records.

Release Date: 05.08.2016

title: Phace - So Excited / Lit Up - NSGNL012
text:

Release Date: 24.06.2016

title: Option - Blueshift / Section 9 - DA001
text:
Blueshift - Opening up with a crisp break and distinct hi-hats, Blueshift sets a tone for a track ready to take you on a journey. A breakdown of an ethereal noisescape split apart by a lumbering sub-bass soon opens up into a masterpiece of drum slicing and gorgeous pads. A relentlessly inspiritive track, be prepared to get lost in it.

Section 9 - Fresh drums and spectral synth work kick off Section 9 leading you unsuspectingly into the drop. The dashing bass-line pairs finely with the energetic drums, like a succulent sirloin with a shiraz, it leaves you smiling ear to ear. Solidly compelling fills keep your interest into the breakdown, the vocal sample peaking your interest and the second drop hits, bouncing your shoulders as rising synths and punchy drums continue you on your way. Definitely one for the crowd and a big system.

Section 9 (Manu remix) - Up steps the man from Detached Audio bringing his take on the uncompromising Section 9. Heâ€™s kept the spirit of Section 9, but made it his own. Stripping the track back to its bare elements, he rebuilds it in a fantastically luxurious way. With enough bass to make your nan even more deaf, his lightly syncopated drum edits weave in and out of overcast pads, creating a sense of accomplished uneasiness. Let this one play out to the end.

Release Date: 14.06.2016
